name: places/ChIJ6QzFjltbwokRhjgdHc01agI
formattedAddress: Governors Island, 112 Andes Rd, New York, NY 10004, USA
adrFormatAddress: Governors Island, 112 Andes Rd, New York, NY 10004, USA

originalText.text:
We visited during holidays and really liked the experience here. Staff were very friendly. I had some issues with my ticket process but the managers helped and it was all good. Facility is very clean and its smells so good! I would love to return during my birthday!

If I had to say few things to improve would be,  pool temperature. We were there during cold weather and the outdoor pool water was not "hot" enough. I think it was just "warm". But that might be just me.
Second thing is, food. Threes not much of options. And I get that its healthy version of food, but when you spa and sweat, sometimes you need more that "healthy" food. Maybe more variety of food selection would be nice!

Overall, it was very nice and very clean! I wish they sell diffusers online! I loved them but you can only get them in the spa.

originalText.text:
I loved my time at QC. I went on a rainy, cold day so it wasn't very crowded. Although we couldn't lounge outside, we had a lovely time in the heated pool and using the foot baths, saunas. We added on a massage which was well worth it. Also there are extra included snacks like dried fruit and cookies with the massage. It's good to know if you need a nibble as the food and drink prices are quite high. I had the chicken curry wrap which was good, but not fantastic.

For the views from the pool and the overall vibe it felt worth it and like a special day. I can't speak to a crowded day there and what that would be like but we really enjoyed it!

originalText.text:
QC NY Spa is a spa on the northern part of Governors Island overlooking the financial district. You buy packages for time and massages are extra, but they have multiple floors of different experiences. You start by getting ready in a locker room where you can store your stuff, then make your way through the amenities. They have almost 10 different sauna style experiences, as well as an aquatic level with a few water related experiences. Outside are heated pools with underwater music or massage chairs with great views of the city.
The staff here are incredible, super nice and helpful. There are towels, scrubs, and directions scattered everywhere. They have food and drinks downstairs which are priced a bit high for the portion sizes, but things like the tiramasu are delicious. You can bring your phone around or even a book to read and relax, although I recommend leaving them behind while on the bottom aquatic level as it's very wet and steamy.
Overall a great experience and the views from the pool alone are worth the money. Would definitely go again in the future.

originalText.text:
Hop the ferry for a 10 minute ride and walk another 10 to get to this lovely spa with phenomenal views.  The outdoor pools and luxurious and there are plenty of places to lounge and relax.  Plenty of spots to hang your things, towels and robes.  Changing areas and showers felt comfortable and well kept, Dyson hair blowers and enough room for a well attended spa in the city.
The spa is modeled on the Italian spa experience, in which you wander and explore to find something new to experience.  I loved that idea, but you might miss a few things.  We found a hidden pool at the end of our 3 hour session and we’re thrilled.   We cannot wait to return.  It was money well spent.

originalText.text: A bit gimmicky with rooms designed clearly for instagram shots but overall worth a fun trip to the island for great city views. Came here after the marathon and did the post 5pm special which I think is the best time to go with the city lit up. Got a decent 25 min massage. Didn’t have a bathing suit but purchased a fairly priced $16 set. Had drinks and did lots of pool time, fireplace room time, and sauna time.
